title: Fragile X syndrome
summary: Fragile X syndrome (FXS) is a genetic disorder characterized by mild-to-moderate intellectual disability.[1] The average IQ in males with FXS is under 55, while about two thirds of affected females are intellectually disabled.[3][4] Physical features may include a long and narrow face, large ears, flexible fingers, and large testicles.[1] About a third of those affected have features of autism such as problems with social interactions and delayed speech.[1] Hyperactivity is common, and seizures occur in about 10%.[1] Males are usually more affected than females.[1]
